issues.description: The textual instructions in Part 2 state that messageOnMilk should have a double parameter (messageOnMilk(double milkVolume)) and include the milk volume in the returned string, but the UML, the template code (Main), and the reference solution all define/use messageOnMilk() without parameters and return a string without a volume. This is a signature/parameter mismatch: students following the textual description would implement an interface and methods with a double parameter that will not match the provided template calls or the test/solution expectations, causing compilation errors or test failures.
issues.suggested_fix: Align the problem statement with the UML/template/solution. Either (A) change the textual instruction to require messageOnMilk() without parameters and specify the return string as "[Animal Type] [name] is milked" (matching UML/Main/solution), or (B) if the intention was to include a milkVolume, update the UML, the template Main invocation, the Milkable interface, and all implementations to use messageOnMilk(double milkVolume) and adjust the expected returned string to include the volume. Option A is the smaller fix and keeps template and solution consistent.

issues.description: The problem text (Part 2) requires a milk method with a double parameter (messageOnMilk(double milkVolume)) and specifies a return format that includes the milk volume ("[Animal Type] [name] is milked (volume: [milkVolume]L)"). However, the template and solution use a parameterless method signature messageOnMilk() (see template Main calling m.messageOnMilk(); and solution Milkable.java declaring String messageOnMilk()). Seal and Goat implementations in the solution also implement the no-argument variant and return strings without the volume. This mismatch between the required method signature/format in the problem statement and the provided/template API will confuse students: they cannot simultaneously satisfy the textual requirement and compile against the provided interfaces/usage in the template/solution.
issues.suggested_fix:
Unify the API across artifacts. Either (A) change the problem statement to require messageOnMilk() with no parameters and show the expected return string without volume (e.g. "[Animal Type] [name] is milked"), matching the template and solution; or (B) update the template and solution to use messageOnMilk(double milkVolume):
- modify Milkable.java to declare String messageOnMilk(double milkVolume);
- update Seal and Goat to implement messageOnMilk(double) and include the volume in the returned string as specified in the problem; and
- update any template code (e.g. Main) to call messageOnMilk(...) with an appropriate double argument. This alignment will remove the compile/runtime mismatch and reduce student confusion.
